reviewText: Too much homosexualism. Destroyed the image I always had of Liberace as the great artist that he was. I was expecting more of his music than of his private life.
summary: Too much of his homosexualism. Unnecessary.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just got done watching this with a 92 yr old neighbor and friend. Both of us remember his show very well.Super Star is used now for an actor in one film,one record,etc Plus,a heck of a lot of  ''stars'' are speechless away from a script. Liberace was a natural !  He ad libed fabulously,had a cute personality,and was an instant TV STAR !!I was  born in 1948 and so happy I grew up in the Golden Age of television. We sat in front of that black and white Crosley tv enjoying Lee's outfits and every minute of the show. Everybody adored him, his sexual preference was never uttered. Who cared? 0nce color tv came to my home we were dazzled as if on drugs. Oh you have no idea of the thrillLiberace would use his beautiful smile working the camera playing the best piano we had ever heard. I am glad my neighbor invited me over to see this. For a short t one I was back in the day.back in that Golden Age.Anybody remember Korla Pandit ? Another guy working the camera but he was a mystery man,very exotic..
Title: N/A

reviewText: The silent section not a good idea.  Did like the rest of the albums very much.  Watched his career from day one.  Will always remember him for the enjoyment he provided.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After watching the latest movie about Liberace, Behind the Candelabra, my husband and I remembered what a wonderful pianist he was.  I ordered the DVD and wow - had forgotten what a showman he was.  I bet he is one of the best that we've ever seen or will see in our lifetime.Could have done without Phyllis Diller's unfunny jokes (there is a fast forward button!) but he had a television show for a while.  Really good to watch the master in action - he makes it all look so simple!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I hope to be able to give a better rating than 2 stars when I've seen the whole thing but I get the feeling that I'm not going to be satisfied with any of it. I had hoped for more biography instead of just snippets of different performances. There is waaaaay too much Phyllis Diller. If I wanted to see a huge performance by Diller I'd buy one of her DVDs. I wish now I'd ordered The Legendary Liberace as I know it is a very good film having seen it on t.v. LATER: I'm very disappointed in this DVD. The home movies they promise are silent. I skipped through most of the scenes with other entertainers as they are so boring. The film quality is poor. I'll give the other disc a try but don't hope for much.
summary: lst disc disappointing,not much hope for 2nd.

reviewText: Shout! Factory does it again with this rare and obscure collection of Liberace's British TV show . Brilliant piano performances by Liberace and great guest star turns by Phyllis Diller Jack Benny and others.
